title: B.1 Sets
content:
Section B.1

Sets

Summary

Basic set theory notation and operations.

Key Points

  • Set: unordered collection of distinct elements
  • ∈ (element of), ⊆ (subset), ∪ (union), ∩ (intersection)
  • Set difference: A - B = {x : x ∈ A and x ∉ B}
  • Power set: 2^A = all subsets of A, |2^A| = 2^|A|
  • Cartesian product: A × B = {(a,b) : a ∈ A, b ∈ B}

Example

A = {1,2,3}, B = {2,3,4}. A ∪ B = {1,2,3,4}, A ∩ B = {2,3}, A - B = {1}.

Why It Matters

Foundation for describing algorithms and data structures.
